Berkley Scholarship Program   Loan Programs   Teaching & Graduate Fellowships   Resources for Military Veterans   Resources for Social Enterprise   Tuition & Cost of Attendance     Admissions Request Information   Apply   Selection Criteria   Deadlines   Notification & Process   Application Instructions   Policies   Directors' Tips   FAQs     Meet With Us Visit Stern   Travel Directions   Events and Webinars   Videos   Day in the Life Student Videos   Podcasts   Virtual Tour   Contact a Student               Home / Programs & Admissions / Full-time MBA / Academics / Specializations / Corporate Finance                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Corporate Finance   Corporate finance focuses primarily on financial issues at the firm level, such as how new companies raise capital, how companies decide on a capital structure of equity versus short-term and long-term debt, and the governance structure of firms. Students develop an understanding of the broad financial issues and choices facing firms and how these choices influence performance, valuation and risk.   Sample Courses:                           Case Studies in Bankruptcy and Reorganization       Corporate Finance       Entrepreneurial Finance       Investment Banking                           Principles of Real Estate Finance       Real Estate Capital Markets       Restructuring Firms and Industries       Valuation                        Please note that this is a selection of courses and is subject to change. For more information, visit the course index .             Especially Applicable to Careers in Finance such as:                           Corporate Finance       Equity and Fixed Income Research       Investment Banking       Mergers and Acquisitions Corporate Finance Lecture Notes                                                                                                             Lecture Notes         Class Materials           Syllabus      Book(s)             Applied Corporate Finance (4th Edition)       Corporate Finance (2nd Edition)                 Lecture Notes      Weekly Puzzles              Class Webcasts           NYU/Stern      iTunes U      Yellowdig      YouTube              The Project           Project Description      Project Materials      In-Practice Webcasts      Past Projects: Summaries      Past Projects: Examples              The Case     Exams & problems           Quiz/Exam Rules      Practice Problems      Past quizzes/exams      Quiz Reviews              In the loop           Calendar      Emails      Newsletters              Support           Data      Spreadsheets      Readings                        You can read these notes online, but the download will take a while, with    images. You can also download the files is portable document format    (pdf) format, if you have Adobe Acrobat installed. If you do not have    an Acrobat reader, you can obtain it free of charge at http://www.adobe.com . If    you want to save yourself some time, you can download all of the notes    in two lecture note packets:      Corporate    finance class syllabus and project description    Lecture  note packet 1: Management Objectives and Investment Analysis . This is a pdf file that works well with tablets/iPads. If you have trouble printing the file, download the powerpoint file . You can then choose to print the slides, one to a page, two or a page, in note format or whatever your heart desires. (Updated for Spring 2015).     Lecture     note packet 2: Capital Structure, Dividend Policy and Valuation . This is a pdf file that works well with tablets/iPads. If you have trouble printing the file, download the powerpoint file . You can then choose to print the slides, one to a page, two or a page, in note format or whatever your heart desires. (Updated for Spring 2015).    You can also download the files for individual topics:    Management Objectives (Download pdf file )     Risk   and Return Models(Download pdf   file )    Estimating   Hurdle Rates (Download pdf   file )    Measuring   Returns on Investments (Download pdf   file )     Dealing   with Side Costs and Benefits (Download pdf  file )     Capital  Structure: Choices (Download pdf  file )    Optimal   Capital Structure (Download pdf  file )    Debt Design (Download pdf  file )    Dividend   Policy (Download pdf   file )     Assessing   Cash Returned to Stockholders (Download pdf   file )    Valuation   (Download pdf   file )
